body:
Thanks, i saw your description in JIRA:

>In the first attempt 1, we write three records 5,4,3 to fileID_1_log.1_attempt1. But this attempt failed. Spark will have a try in the second task attempt (attempt 2), we write four records 1,2,3,4 to  fileID_1_log.1_attempt2. And then, we find this filegroup is large enough by call canWrite. So hudi write record 5 to fileID_2_log.1_attempt2 and finish this commit.

Do you mean the attempt 1 writes a complete/full log block in the log file then failed ? Can we write a rollback block when spark tasl failover there ?

If we made the change as this path, the ability for precise file size control/bin-packing lost.

> @YannByron yeah, i read t/h the ticket so this is not blocking the review (i'm half-way through it).
> 
> However, folks, let's get into the habit of following the already setup format of how PRs descriptions are shaped so that it's easier for reviewers to understand what changes are about w/o need to go to JIRA.

That's great. I'll edit the pr description. Thank you for your remind.
Closing in lieu of https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4752
@hudi-bot run azure
hi @nsivabalan @danny0405 I will resubmit this patch at a later time, I will temporarily close it.
+1 generally for the timeline server based instant request, we already did that for MARKER files already, what do you think @vinothchandar , do we need a new RFC here ?
Yeah, the timestamp_LTZ is not supported yet for flink, i have fired a JIRA to support this feature: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-3388
@nsivabalan Your plan to not schedule clean when another is in progress works. Can you please make that change and I can close this PR? Happy to review the other PR too.

@danny0405 : addressed your feedback

@nsivabalan @prashantwason 

I had been waiting for @vinothchandar 's review on this. Let me address the existing comments so we can land this.

hi @nsivabalan, if users have a separate job to execute the already scheduled compaction plans, do the job have to configure OPTIMISTIC CONCURRENCY (lock provider)? If not, what if one writer append records to the same log file that is being compact concurrently?
@nsivabalan Apologies for the delay. I have asked for few clarifications. Let us land this one once the questions are addressed.

CI passes.
![1C1874F4-B53E-4979-A1A7-B9D2895F2861](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2497195/152947621-4614b4b3-cfe8-45aa-b05b-0235526c6589.jpeg)
Thanks a lot for your help @yihua and @nsivabalan :)

> @zhangyue19921010 : you are bringing up a good point. if I am not wrong, you are talking about a scenario, where someone triggered delete_partition for partition X and later added new data to the same partition is it? if yes, I see there could be some inconsistencies especially w/ async cleaner.
> 
> t10: trigger delete partition of partitionX. async cleaner is enabled and so, actual delete partition is not yet synced to metadata table. t15: add new data to partition X which gets synced to Metadata table right away. t20: async cleaner completes and deletes partition X. which gets synced to metadata table and deletes partition X.
> 
> Or were you talking about some other scenario ?

Yes, it is. Just a little concern that maybe need to take care of :)
@hudi-bot run azure
@nsivabalan Please take a pass.

Hi there. Trying to `find all such places for getting write stats, to eliminate all similar problems`.
But it seems that new commit couldn't trigger CI job running. Could you please give me a hand, really appreciate it :>
Yes, my issue is related to #4206.

@jaxonzhang : nope. not required. Lock provider is required if scheduling is also done async. Scheduling is the crux or critical section here where no concurrent writers should be operating. So, if scheduling is done inline by regular writer, and execution is done by async process, no lock provider is required.
Since https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4753 didn't trigger CI job. Just raise another PR to do test work.
thanks for confirming. will go ahead and close the issue.
thanks!
@wjcwin : if you can respond to Yann's question above (code, etc), would help us. since Yann is not able to reproduce
can we file a jira please as we try to get consensus
Can we please file a jira. I see lot of discussions going on. So, may not be trivial.
can we please file a jira.

> Thanks for the contribution ~ I kind of think we better do this after id-based schema evolution is supported, only after that, we have more light-wright solution to support per-record schema.
> 
> Generally, take schema with record seems not a good solution.

Yeah, agree with taking schema with record is not a good solution, it couple the byte data with schema and hard to evolute schema later, but it seems that we cannot merge two `Payload` without schema. I also tired if we can pass the `schema` to `#preCombine` method, just similar with `#combineAndGetUpdateValue`. But we only can get the schema info from flink configuration, the `FlinkWriteHelper` doesn't(and should not) support flink configuration to support retrieve schema from configuration, so I have to inject schema via constructor.
@YannByron : yes. lets go w/ what you have suggested.
@hudi-bot run azure
@hudi-bot run azure

They are not used to project what's ready by FileReader, but used to construct reader-schema w/in the `RecordReader`:
https://github.com/apache/hudi/blob/master/hudi-hadoop-mr/src/main/java/org/apache/hudi/hadoop/realtime/AbstractRealtimeRecordReader.java#L107

Hive architecture is unfortunate

> Hi, do you use Glue 2.0?
> If so, try with Glue 3.0

not sure how to check that, but that makes sense that feature is not
available in my glue metastore version.

thanks Sagar for bringing up a good point. Just playing devil's advocate. Spark in general has much incompatability issues even after being very mature. So, for the benefit we get (same behavior across bulk insert and other operations), I am thinking if we can go ahead with this change. Again, my assumption is that w/ non row writer operations, we are already honoring micro secs with timestamp type. 

Even today, users have some inconsistencies here which they are living with. 
especially given this is not affecting partition path flow. just some random timestamp type fields. @YannByron : correct me if I am mistaken in any of the above statements.
sounds good 👍
@guyuqi : Is there any updates for us. We plan to get this into 0.11. Thats why being pushy. sorry about that.
CI jobs are passed https://dev.azure.com/apache-hudi-ci-org/apache-hudi-ci/_build/results?buildId=5802&view=results

> @zhedoubushishi : we are looking to see if we can get this in for 0.11. Can you follow up on the feedback. and create a jira as well please.

Hi, sure I just created one: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-3395

Hi @alexeykudinkin @yihua CI jobs are all passed https://dev.azure.com/apache-hudi-ci-org/apache-hudi-ci/_build/results?buildId=5802&view=results in https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4765
I believe this PR is ready for review. Could you please take a look at your convince？Thanks a lot.
CC @danny0405 and @xiarixiaoyao 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69956021/153096567-27fe23ab-b1c6-4695-be6e-e19f8b70b734.png)

> @zhangyue19921010 can you please add a regression test for this case?

Sure, Just modify all related testes to guard it.
This PR is duplicated as https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4750.

@guanziyue : thanks for the fix. I get the actual problem and the short term fix. But let's not make this the only viable option. Can we make this configurable. 
ideally, we should fix the markers for log files or as you suggest, we should go w/ generating compaction plan from append result rather than listing.
btw, we are looking to get this in for 0.11. Would appreciate if you can address the feedback. Or even if you wish to take a stab at proper solution, I can help review if need be and speed it up.

@liujinhui1994 per our discussions, some points here
- `hoodie.parquet.encryption.keys` can be used as the switch. default to not set. if not set, then encryption feature is disabled. any parquet settings users provide will be ignored
- If users enable encryption but `hoodie.table.base.file.format` is not parquet, there should be some warning to highlight it to the users
- it'll be good to mark this as experimental feature. you can clarify this with more details (like why experimental) in the config's docs and related java classes' docs. Release notes will also highlight it.

Hi @nsivabalan and @danny0405 Thanks a lot for you review. 
Now we add a property named supportsRetry each StorageScheme. And check it before retry.

Also and a new config named `hoodie.filesystem.operation.retry.exceptions` to give users an option to decide which Exceptions that needs to be re-tryed. It could solve the overprotection problem.

> In that case, I think we can just have the config alone. and let the user decide. From vinothchandar

updated: only check `hoodie.filesystem.operation.retry.enable` before using retryHelper.


PTAL :) Thanks a lot.
